entry.title: FREEZING DRIZZLE ADVISORY , St. John's
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 05:05 AM NDT Saturday 18 March 2023

entry.title: Current Conditions: Light Freezing Drizzle, -1.0°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: St. John's Int'l Airport 06:30 AM NDT Saturday 18 March 2023
Condition: Light Freezing Drizzle
Temperature: -1.0°C
Pressure / Tendency: 99.9 kPa rising
Visibility: 4.8 km
Humidity: 99 %
Wind Chill: -8
Dewpoint: -1.2°C
Wind: NNW 32 km/h
Air Quality Health Index: 2

entry.title: Saturday: Periods of freezing drizzle. High plus 1.
entry.summary: Periods of freezing drizzle or flurries ending near noon then cloudy. Wind northwest 30 km/h gusting to 50. High plus 1. Wind chill minus 8 this morning. UV index 2 or low. Forecast issued 05:30 AM NDT Saturday 18 March 2023

entry.title: Saturday night: Snow mixed with freezing rain. Low minus 2.
entry.summary: Mainly cloudy. Snow mixed with freezing rain beginning overnight. Wind up to 15 km/h. Low minus 2. Wind chill minus 6 overnight. Forecast issued 05:30 AM NDT Saturday 18 March 2023

entry.title: Sunday: Periods of rain or freezing rain. High plus 4.
entry.summary: Periods of freezing rain or rain changing to periods of rain in the morning and ending late in the afternoon then cloudy. Rainfall amount 2 to 4 mm. Wind becoming southeast 30 km/h gusting to 50 in the morning then becoming southwest 30 gusting to 50 in the afternoon. High plus 4. Wind chill minus 5 in the morning. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 05:30 AM NDT Saturday 18 March 2023

entry.title: Sunday night: Chance of flurries. Low minus 2. POP 60%
entry.summary: Cloudy periods with 60 percent chance of flurries. Windy. Low minus 2. Forecast issued 05:30 AM NDT Saturday 18 March 2023
